meanings.definition: An area of land at the foot of a mountain or mountain range.
meanings.sent1: The small town nestled in the piedmont was surrounded by majestic mountains.
meanings.sent2: The hikers set up camp in the piedmont before starting their ascent up the mountain.
meanings.sent3: The animals in the piedmont were known for their love of climbing the nearby hills.
meanings.sent4: The piedmont stood like a loyal guard at the base of the towering mountain.
meanings.sent5: The piedmont, with its gentle slopes, provided a perfect transition from the flatlands to the rugged peaks.

meanings.definition: A plateau region at the base of a mountain range.
meanings.sent1: The lush forests in the piedmont were home to many unique species of plants.
meanings.sent2: Farmers in the piedmont region grew crops that thrived in the cool mountain climate.
meanings.sent3: The piedmont plateau was so flat that even the cows enjoyed playing soccer there.
meanings.sent4: The piedmont plateau resembled a giant step leading up to the grand mountains.
meanings.sent5: The piedmont, with its expansive views, felt like a peaceful haven away from the bustling city.
